Title: Hymn to Every Other

In the morning tranquility,
Snow nestles performances, tender hymns
Sung for the edges of being.
Through the rafters drifts acceptance,
A message, shrouded in white mystery,
From Scissorhands and Christmas' stage.
In our hearts, each subtly stitched seam,
Echoes Burton's film, a clever adaptation.
Snowflakes, like us: different, fragile, fleeting.
Each is a story in the grand ballet of acceptance.
